headline: Creamy White Chili
description: This white chicken chili recipe is made with chicken breasts and canned white beans slow-simmered with green chiles, spices, and sour cream.

video.name: How to Make Creamy White Chicken Chili

name: Creamy White Chili
recipeIngredient: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
2 (15.5 ounce) cans great Northern beans, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add chicken, onion, and garlic; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 10 to 15 minutes.
Stir in beans, chicken broth, green chiles, salt, cumin, oregano, black pepper, and cayenne pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until flavors have blended, about 30 minutes.
Remove chili from heat; stir in sour cream and whipping cream until incorporated.

review.reviewBody: Perfect seasonings. I like spicey, wife not so much, but we both loved it. Used Ro Tel original in place of green chilis because that's what we had available. Let simmer for 2 hours, no lid, to reduce liquid.
cooking it now so excited

Very disappointing. Not creamy at all more like chicken with beans soup. Followed the recipe exactly and it was nothing like some of the reviews. Too soupy and not flavorful with an unappealing bland appearance.
Love the flavors- added long grain rice in place of 1 can of beans. Will definitely try this one again! Thanks
The flavor is incredible! The only change I made was to use 32 oz of broth/stock to thin it and it was perfect!
Loved this creamy delicious chili. I had some poblano peppers on hand so used those instead of canned. I used corn starch to thicken it a bit at the end of cooking with the cream and sour cream.
This was great! Easy - full of flavor. I used one can mild green chilis and one hot. It gave it just a little heat - would definitely make again.

Life-changing!!! Delicious, fabulous, amazing, BURSTING with flavor, very forgiving AND as easy and versatile as you want it to be. I mean WOW. Can you believe my family & I had never even tried a white-chicken-chili?? (LOL yes, apprehensive, late arrivals.) I made a triple batch the 1st time on stovetop & used 1 lb. dry beans, to feed my family of 5. This time, made it in crockpot with 3 cans beans, and a small fraction of the black pepper. (Hubby tried to get me to double my triple batch lol, but crockpot was filled it to the brim). I always read reviews & take heed to repeated ones. I add cream & sour cream at the end, and if it's too soupy before doing that, I mix 2-4 TB of cornstarch with water or some of the soup or even the cream, then mix it in. EVERY drop of leftovers, even a few days out, gets eaten. THANK YOU for sharing!!

This recipe gets a solid five stars. I made it according to the recipe, including the hot sauce, Fritos, and jalapeños as shown in the video. My only regret is that I did not make a double recipe. It was even delicious leftover. Absolutely fantastic! I can’t wait to make it again.
We absolutely love this recipe, we never have any leftovers.

My husband I both like the flavor of this chili. He thinks it's a bit too soupy but I like it that way. I do not add the sour cream to the pot, but let each person add it to their bowl to their taste.
My Husband and Daughter liked it. I though it had nice flavor, but maybe not so healthy with the cream. My Son didn't care for it and I'm not really sure why.

I think this was a good base recipe, but we didn't really follow the ingredients or cooking method. I didn't add sour cream or cream, but did use 32 oz swanson chkn stock, 2 cans of great northern beans and 1 can of cannellini beans. Thickened with 2 Tbsp flour/butter paste/ roux and added chicken at the end for only about 5 minutes since it was small. Used a lg serving spoon of whipped cream cheese at the end for creaminess. We really liked it, but also didn't use the green chillies, black pepper or cayenne, instead used white pepper, onion powder, goya adobo, celery salt, Italian seasoning, oregano, and a little TJ's mushroom powder. I also added 1 lg chopped carrot. So basically it's a totally different recipe, but again this recipe was a good starting point.
I adore this recipe and actually won a chili cookoff with it. My whole family loves it :)

I made this and it was delicious. I changed the recipe up a bit. I added one can of cream of corn. I omitted the garlic as my guest is sensitive. I allowed the chili to thicken on the stove and added 1 tbsp of corn starch. I served with sour cream, cheddar cheese and corn chips. I added a salad and this meal was a huge hit!

I've used this as a base recipe for years now. It's wonderful as is but is easy to customize depending on what you might have on hand or to your taste. For example, I only use 2 cup of chicken broth made with Better Than Bouillion, 1/2 an onion, extra garlic and 1 can of green chiles. I never add the cumin (we don't care for it). I also increase the whipping cream to 3/4 cup and only use a dollop of sour cream. A roasted Anaheim pepper goes great in this as well.
The best

Made this on a raw, rainy day and family liked it. I did use a rotisserie chicken and boiled the bones to make the broth. It was too thin for my taste so I added a 3rd can of beans, pureed with it's liquid. That helped, but not enough for my taste; more like a chowder than a chili. It was ok, but I probably won't make it again.
It's a great recipe. As others say I would add a little flour to thicken it. The sour cream is a little overwhelming so I'd definitely add a little more salt to balance the soup out.

This is the best white chili recipe I have ever made! My family gets really annoyed if I try different recipes. I always use only one can of green chiles, and leave out the cayenne. This time I used canned chicken which made it come together more quickly. Delicious recipe! Also, it goes in the crockpot every time. This makes the house smell really good all day until supper.
Only thing I would change is maybe adding more heat for my husband 😀
no green chiles so used poblano pepper. Also subbed half and half for heavy cream. Made 4 very large bowls

My "Alexa" recommended this recipe to me and it is to die for! I have made it several times and wouldn't change a thing except once I used rotisserie chicken and thought that was better than the cut chicken breast. Other than that, you can't go wrong with this simply delicious recipe.
Made as presented. Easy, I did cut the cayenne back to half called for. We enjoyed it.
Great chili and easy. Used some flour to thicken it .I will make this again. It just was so good on a cold rainy day.
Delicious. I added some frozen peas for color and served on rice to soak up the broth; then topped with sharp old cheddar. Will definitely make again!
Delicious! I put crushed tortilla chips on after serving with a sprinkle of Monterey Jack cheese.

First time making this was a hit! I used a mix of Northern Beans and Cannellini beans. Added a bit extra garlic and cayenne, but otherwise stuck to the recipe. Only adjustment would be to use a smidge less broth next time. Will definitely make this again!
I made as directed except I used shredded rotisserie chicken breasts and I added 1 brick of hot pepper cheese for a bit more kick. Everyone loved it!
Threw in some bell peppers with the onion, and some cheese with the sour cream. Did not have heavy whipping cream. 10/10 would make again.
Delicious and super easy to make. I made a vegetarian version without the chicken and it still tastes delicious. Perfect with cheese and tortilla chips on top.
Followed the recipe, but added diced pablano peppers and a little extra cayenne . It was delicious!

Fantastic chili recipe. My family asks me to make this all the time. I now make triple recipes and vacuum seal servings for freezing. It is just as good after being thawed and warmed up again. Friends request the recipe after eating it for the first time.
Amazing! Family loved this recipe and will use this again!!!!
Delicious.
My family loved this. Grandkids normally wouldn't eat. Chili but tried this and went back for seconds.
This recipe is great and I have made many times. The flavor is great. Definitely worth trying. The only thing I do different is a cook my chicken first and shred it other than cube it.

This recipe is so easy and so good. Any of my friends who have tried it have asked for this recipe. The only problem I have had is it’s too thin in the end of cooking and I thicken it up with flour and water just a little bit and it’s perfect.

I had never heard of White Chili so had to give it a try and I am glad I did! I followed recipe to the t and it was flawless and extremely delicious. I pass along to friends all the time and this wins over red chili at my table. BTW.. This review is quite old - somehow it never posted til I edited but 5 starts then and now.

I followed your recipe exactly and this was a huge success with my friends, family and some coworkers. They all wanted this recipe after they finished eating. Thank you this is the best creamy white chicken chili I’ve ever made or ever tasted.

The family likes a thicker chili. Added another can of Great Northern beans which I smashed before adding to the chili. Also added 1/2 cup of all purpose flour to thicken the chili. I replaced the sour cream and whipping cream with a can of coconut cream. Big hit with the family.
I used one can of green chilies and one can of jalapenos. I topped with shredded white cheddar and diced avocado. Delicious!

Will be making it again.!! I cooked the chicken (50% extra), onion, and garlic in the oil and then transferred it to the slow cooker with the remaining ingredients except for the creams (swapping 1 can of navy, 1 can of pinto, and 1 can of peaches & cream corn for the 2 cans of great north beans). The additional chicken and corn made it nice and hearty. Once I turned the heat off, I added the whipping cream and sour cream marking sure it sat for 5-10 minutes so the flavours absorbed nicely. Served it with nacho chips on the side.

It had a perfect mix of flavors. But, unless you love extra green chilis, I would only use one can. It was perfect with one. Two definitely would have been too much. I also used half and half instead of heavy cream. Will be making it again.

So good!!! I'm the only person in earth who still has a George foreman grill so I let the beans and whatnot get to know each other in the pot, while I cook the chicken until it still has a little pink. Then I put it in there so it can get more flavor but not get tough.
Used evaporated milk instead of heavy cream. Turkey instead of chicken. Skipped the cumin (& cilantro).

Awesomely tasty recipe. Not usually a fan this chili but this recipe changed that! I did tweak a little… added a large jalapeño chopped, 1/2 tsp of “Tastefully Simple-Wahoo Chili” seasoning, and 1/8 cup of fresh cilantro. Our new FAV for Super Bowl Sunday!
Best white chili I’ve ever made
This is my new favorite recipe. I have made it several times and always comes out perfect.

I prefer baking and shredding the chicken than the cubes. I also add a cup of pepper jack cheese near the end. If you you want it thicker, try blending 1 can of beans with 1/4 cup of stock and adding in near the end of the simmer.

Love it! I would have added more chik though.
Thanks for sharing!
This is the best white chicken chili I have ever had. I have had so many people want this recipe. It's a big hit. From now on this is the only White Chili I will ever make!!

This recipe is the bomb diggity. The only changes I made was instead of chicken breasts, I subbed in chicken thighs and instead of navy beans, I'm a suckered for Pinto beans. The only reason for having leftovers in my household is because it was just my wife and I eating but otherwise I just can't imagine having any left over when served to a larger family. Absolutely an outstanding tasting chili. Follow the directions and you'll think so too.
We enjoyed very much. Just barely fed 5 people though. Next time will def double! yumms

Holy one of the most delicious things I’ve ever eaten. Easy to make. I used about 1/2 cup of chopped jalapeños from garden instead of canned chilis. The heat is even. I topped with a dollup of sour cream. Thank you I will make this a million more times.

Not just good - REALLY good! A recipe catches my eye, then I scroll through the reviews. I always look for the common thread, in this case, “too soupy”, so I used 1 cup chicken broth instead of the whole can, as per reviewers’ suggestion. It was perfect. The sour cream adds a nice little tang so don’t leave it out.

My family loves this chili. I follow the recipe exactly except for using the cayenne pepper. Our 9-year-old grandson lives with us and he's not a real fan of any heat.

My only issue is that at least for us, there aren't 8 servings...we get about 3 1/2 servings from it, so I'm going to start doubling the recipe. We want it the next day too!

Pretty yummy. I reserved about 1/3 of the broth and it was still soupy. I certainly don’t mind but if you’re looking for something the consistency of normal chili, this is not the recipe. Instead of heavy cream, I used oat creamer and only used 3/4 of the sour cream to try and cut back on the dairy. It was still great. If anything, I think I will add another can of beans next time and maybe try chicken thighs!
Added a little white wine, garlic salt and chili powder to add more flavor. Topped with Monterey Jack and tortilla strips. Great recipe!

Added diced potatoes and corn to make it more like a chowder. My guys loved it. I’ve also used dark meat chicken, rotisserie chicken (leftovers) and dark meat turkey in this recipe. All gave awesome results. I did add some poultry seasoning to the turkey for more flavor.

We loved this chili! Next time, I will use a little less cayenne. I cooked my chicken separately so I could shred it. I don't like sour cream so I used one can cream of chicken soup and added 1 cup of the cream instead of 1/2 cup. It was not too thick or thin. The spices are spot on and this is so easy to make!

I agree with a lot of the reviews, who state that the chili is too “soupy”. I had to make a roux with flour and butter to thicken it up. It’s also on the spicy side - which I personally love, but may not be for everyone. I made it “as-is” and I’m basing my review on such. It was better after adding the roux and thickening it up. I do believe that 1/2 ground chicken would help with this dish.
My family LOVES this chili, it is now in my fall/winter recipes!! Could absolutely drink the broth, the heat is just perfect!! Only change I added 1 more can of beans.
Very tasty and keto friendly and spicy
Delish!! I didn't add the oregano or sour cream (thickened with cornstarch instead). This will go into my recipe box for sure.

Turned out fab! Instead of two cans of chopped Chilis, I only used one. I added five fresh hatch chili peppers (chopped) in when sautéing the onions. I will definitely be making this again, perhaps next time with an extra can of beans for a heartier texture.
I entered a chili cook off with this recipe at a church and I won. I highly recommend this recipe.

A big hit. I have fixed it twice now. My sister is s bit wimpy when it comes to spice so I only used one can of the green chilis and s dash of cayenne. Wonderful stuff. Thank you for a simple and tasty recipe

I made it as written, but used a 1lb bag of dried great northern beans and used about 2 Cups of shredded COSTCO rotisserie chicken. I also used cream cheese instead of sour cream as suggested in the recipe since I had it on hand. Excellent flavor and thickness.
This is now one of our favorites!!!
It's a very simple recipe to prep & it has so much flavor. i used a little less chicken breast and added some chicken sausages.
My whole family loves this recipe
I love this recipe. To thicken I like to add corn meal towards the end while still cooking on the stove. This is the type of recipe that you can tweak to your preference.
Followed recipe....FABULOUS!!!
I didn't have enough sour cream and used half and half instead of whipping cream and it still turned out great. My family liked it.
I made it exactly as written but did reduce the spices a little. It’s delicious and will definitely make again.
Used ground chicken, a little less sour cream and a little more heavy cream. Also cooked some white rice and spooned in individual servings to add depth... Great recipe!

This was the best chicken white chili recipe I've had! Super good - I used the reduced fat sour cream and fat free half/half. I did add some chili flakes and a 1/2 can of corn (drained). I would recommend this to anyone!
Wow -- great recipe! I added a diced jalapeno pepper in with the onions, then decreased the cayenne a little bit. It was perfectly spicy and everyone raved about it! Thank you :)

Super easy and yummy! Followed recipe generally, thickened it up a bit tho. Couldn’t find great northern beans used butter beans and white navy beans it’s was yummy. Used a roasted chicken from Costco shredded it in broth, green chili; added sautéed until clear onions, garlic. Heavy cream, sour cream when cooked made it white. Added chicken bullion cubes, 3. Super yummy! A favorite for sure. Thickening is key tho. Great find!
OMG! I am not a chili fan but I wanted something hot and filling to make with my leftover chicken. I had all the ingredients, so I tried it. It was so good! Thus, a pic of an empty bowl.

I made this several times and it’s so good. We all at some point start to make changes of our own. The last couple times I used “chicken of the woods “ mushrooms in place of chicken and honestly people can’t tell it’s not chicken. It’s a great alternative for a meatless pot of chili. I also sprinkle the top with Monterey Jack cheese, cilantro, avocado and lime.

Oh my goodness!! Loved this recipe!! I used Vegan Sour Cream, Cannellini beans and half 'n half because that's what I had, mild green chili's and Young Living Vitality Essential Oils of oregano, black pepper and cumin to add a punch to the herbs. It was delicious to the last mouthful. I may try 1 hot and 1 mild can of green chili's the next time I make it to walk on the "wild side!"

I was fairly happy with the overall flavor of the “chili” but I followed the recipe exactly as written and ended up with soup. There was no creamy or thick or chili aspect to it, it was as “watery” as the chicken broth used. I then tried to thicken it up with a third can of puréed beans but no such luck. This was a good chicken soup.
This is delicious! I used a little extra chicken broth. Yummy!
It's a good tasting recipe. However, I would use more beans.
Delicious flavors! This will be a repeat for sure!
I added a can of drained corn and only used one can of green chiles. Easy and delicious!

I'm about to make my second batch of this. Do Not pass this up, it's fantastic. I commented to a friend of mine that it may very well be the best thing I have ever made. I'm single (Hint to the ladies) so I froze more than half of this. It froze well and I have finished it off. I did add about 4 oz of cream cheese to the left over. I will not use heavy cream this time, Half and Half and 8 oz of cream cheese in place of the heavy whipping cream. Mild green chilis. That's Black Pepper and ground cilantro on it

I made this with only a small alteration to preparation. I used instant pot to cook chicken 20 min on high pressure. Combined nondairy ingredients in crockpot on high for 2 hours removed heat added dairy products. Best chicken chili ever.
Excellent chili - great flavors!
Loved it. Simple and delicious.

My husband likes this so much he took a bowl out to the guy who was changing the tire on a piece of heavy equipment. His compliment to the chef was “ she hit it out of the park”. The only thing I have ever change was the beans to chickpeas. They’re white too. Thank you to the original post.

Excellent chili. The only thing I modified was I started with 1 lb dried beans (quick soak, then simmered for a couple of hours with salt, pepper, onion powder) and then doubled the recipe. Took this to a small family meal knowing some of them don't like sour cream, so I mixed the sour cream and heavy cream together but brought it in a separate container. People loved it without the sour cream mixture! But I added it to mine and yeah...it was superb! Cheese on top was good too! I'm saving this one.

Delicious! One of the better chicken chili recipes and very easy to throw together! The only thing I added was celery, just because I had it, otherwise I made it exactly as written. This one is a keeper!
Spectacular! I added finely chopped carrots, and sauteed the onions and carrots together until they started browning on the edges. Also used powdered garlic because I ran out of fresh.
Was a great hit with my family, even my mother who is not crazy about beans.
So simple to make. I love one pan recipes that tastes great too!! I didn't use sour cream or heavy cream since we are eating less dairy, but I added a lil almond milk instead.

Everyone thought it was delicious. It was a bit spicy for me but I am a wuss. We must be big eaters because it only made enough for 6. There definitely wasn't any leftovers! Thanks for sharing the recipe
